channel.description: Recent content in authors on Janani Ravi

item.title: Black Swan by Nassim Taleb
item.description: Book Review I find myself increasingly drawn to the field of Behavioral Economics (so much so that I was considering a second PhD to channelize my love!), and how beautifully evasive these concepts are in real life. Starting with Daniel Kahneman’s Thinking Fast and Slow, followed by the writings and blogs of Steven Levitt, Dan Ariely, Nate Silver and Barry Schwartz (and still others like Malcolm Gladwell), has set me thinking a lot about how insane and illogical we are.

item.title: Becoming Steve Jobs by Brent Schlender
item.description: Becoming Steve Jobs by Brent Schlender is a well-written biography of Steve Jobs & is definitely much better than Walter Isaacson’s ‘official’ one! And yeah, it is much more than a boring compendium of wiki and news articles. :) So, happy reading!
